lessons.title: Candlestick Fundamentals
lessons.content:
# 🕯 Candlestick Basics

## 🎯 Goal
Learn what candlesticks are, how OHLC works, bullish vs bearish candles, wicks, dojis, and trend/consolidation concepts.

## 📊 What You'll Learn

• **OHLC Data** — Open, High, Low, Close
• **Bullish vs Bearish** candles and what they mean
• **Wicks and Shadows** — volatility indicators
• **Doji Patterns** — market indecision signals
• **Trend vs Consolidation** identification

## 🕯 Candlestick Anatomy

**Body (Open to Close):**
• Green body = bullish (close > open)
• Red body = bearish (close < open)
• Large body = strong momentum
• Small body = indecision

**Wicks/Shadows (High/Low):**
• Long upper wick = rejection of highs
• Long lower wick = rejection of lows
• No wicks = strong directional move
• Long wicks = volatility and indecision

## 🔍 Key Patterns

**Doji:**
• Small body, long wicks
• Market indecision
• Potential reversal signal
• Volume confirms direction

**Hammer/Hanging Man:**
• Long lower wick, small body
• Hammer = bullish reversal
• Hanging man = bearish reversal
• Context matters

**Shooting Star/Inverted Hammer:**
• Long upper wick, small body
• Shooting star = bearish
• Inverted hammer = bullish
• Location is key

## 📈 Trend vs Consolidation

**Trending Candles:**
• Consistent body direction
• Small wicks
• Higher highs, higher lows (uptrend)
• Lower highs, lower lows (downtrend)

**Consolidation Candles:**
• Mixed body directions
• Long wicks
• Sideways price action
• Breakout potential

## 💡 Why No XP Yet
This is foundation knowledge — reward comes when you can apply it in a full chart analysis.

## 📝 Mini-Task (Optional)
Identify a recent candlestick on a chart and label its open, high, low, and close. Note whether it's bullish or bearish and what the wicks tell you about market sentiment.

assignment.title: ✅ Final Course Assignment: Multi-Indicator Chart Breakdown
assignment.instructions:
## 📦 Deliverables

**Screenshot of a chart** (any asset, any timeframe) marked-up with:

• **Candlestick pattern** or trend observation
• **RSI reading** or divergence noted
• **Bollinger Band positioning** (squeeze, breakout, or mean reversion)
• **Fibonacci retracement/extension zones**
• **Short written breakdown** (4–6 sentences) explaining how these tools align

## 🎯 Requirements

• Use at least 3 of the 4 indicators covered
• Show clear annotations on the chart
• Explain the confluence of signals
• Include your trading bias (bullish/bearish)
• Suggest potential entry/exit points

## 📤 Submission Format

Submit as either:
• A screenshot with markup
• A Google/Notion Doc with embedded chart
• A PDF with annotations

## 💡 Pro Tips

• Choose a recent chart with clear signals
• Look for multiple confirmations
• Be specific about your analysis
• Quality over quantity
• Show your thinking process
